intro: Lippia oxycnemis, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its compact growth habit and vibrant floral display make it a notable species in its native range. Lippia oxycnemis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
